title: Day 10 : 24 July 2002 (7 entries)
content:
Sorry for the delay in getting these posted, especially if they're your design. We're still missing a few who didn't convert their fonts to outlines. (C'mon people, read the instructions!)   
   
 ![001front](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110135033im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/1864.jpg)   
   
 ![001back](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110135033im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/1865.jpg)

author: Jared Benson

comments.content: 10.006 is probably my favorite of this batch. What do you guys think?

Yeah. I was down on Futura for a while, in favor of trendier or more obscure typefaces. Now I realize the error of my ways.   
   
Might also be nice in New Century Schoolbook, but Futura works for me ��why mess with a classic...

Joe�   
   
I know the feeling. Our studio was all about Futura for many years as well.   
   
Sometimes the flavor comes from the concept, and they type just needs to be the quiet messenger.

Live a few years in Germany and you will have to get a good eyedoctor, because appr. 20% of all text is set in Futura.....   
   
Jacques   
   
Futura is conceptually very good, but that's all
Fortunately this example isn't a text setting.
